that: to, in order to, that, so that
Den bigiman e kon makandra fu taki a moni tori.
The boys said that they would come back: The leaders come together (in order) to discuss the money situation.
De jongens zeiden dat ze morgen terug zu: De leiders komen bij elkaar om de geldzaak te bespreken.

A lobi en leki en eigi pikin.
The boys said that they would come back: She loves her like her own child.
De jongens zeiden dat ze morgen terug zu: Ze houdt van haar als haar eigen kind.

Na a bigi alen fu freida meki tak' furu sma no kon.
The boys said that they would come back: The heavy rain on Friday caused many people not to come.
De jongens zeiden dat ze morgen terug zu: De zware regen van vrijdag was de oorzaak dat vele mensen niet kwamen.

Den boi disi e wroko tranga neleki fa den ppa ben wroko tranga.
The boys said that they would come back: These boys work hard just like their father did.
De jongens zeiden dat ze morgen terug zu: Deze jongens werken hard, net zoals hun vader dat deed.

Someni sani ben de fu nyan, soleki her'heri, moksi-aleisi, losi fowru, kari kon.
The boys said that they would come back: There were so many things to eat, such as her’heri, moksi-aleisi, baked chicken, and so forth.
De jongens zeiden dat ze morgen terug zu: Er was zoveel te eten, zoals her'heri, moksi-aleisi, geroosterde kip, enzovoorts.

Yu denki taki yu o man du en?
The boys said that they would come back: Do you think that you can do it?
De jongens zeiden dat ze morgen terug zu: Denk je dat je het kunt doen?
